colour.models.dataset.srgb Module¶

sRGB Colourspace¶

Defines the sRGB colourspace:

  • sRGB_COLOURSPACE.

See also

RGB Colourspaces IPython Notebook

References

[1]International Electrotechnical Commission. (1999). IEC 61966-2-1:1999 - Multimedia systems and equipment - Colour measurement and management - Part 2-1: Colour management - Default RGB colour space - sRGB, 51. Retrieved from https://webstore.iec.ch/publication/6169
[2]International Telecommunication Union. (2002). Parameter values for the HDTV standards for production and international programme exchange BT Series Broadcasting service. In Recommendation ITU-R BT.709-5 (Vol. 5, pp. 1–32). Retrieved from http://www.itu.int/dms_pubrec/itu-r/rec/bt/R-REC-BT.709-5-200204-I!!PDF-E.pdf

sRGB colourspace primaries.

sRGB_PRIMARIES : ndarray, (3, 2)

colour.models.dataset.srgb.sRGB_ILLUMINANT = u'D65'¶

sRGB colourspace whitepoint name as illuminant.

sRGB_WHITEPOINT : unicode

colour.models.dataset.srgb.sRGB_WHITEPOINT = (0.31271, 0.32902)¶

sRGB colourspace whitepoint.

sRGB_WHITEPOINT : tuple

colour.models.dataset.srgb.sRGB_TO_XYZ_MATRIX = array([[ 0.41238656, 0.35759149, 0.18045049], [ 0.21263682, 0.71518298, 0.0721802 ], [ 0.01933062, 0.11919716, 0.95037259]])¶

sRGB colourspace to CIE XYZ tristimulus values matrix.

sRGB_TO_XYZ_MATRIX : array_like, (3, 3)

colour.models.dataset.srgb.XYZ_TO_sRGB_MATRIX = array([[ 3.24100326, -1.53739899, -0.49861587], [-0.96922426, 1.87592999, 0.04155422], [ 0.05563942, -0.2040112 , 1.05714897]])¶

CIE XYZ tristimulus values to sRGB colourspace matrix.

XYZ_TO_sRGB_MATRIX : array_like, (3, 3)
